alert.note: Alert for Cheshire (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 3:49PM EDT until July 09 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Cheshire County in southern New Hampshire... * Until 1000 PM EDT Sunday. * At 349 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Winchester. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 4 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring and parts of Route 10 are closed due to flooding. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Keene, Swanzey, Winchester, Richmond, Troy, Hinsdale and Marlborough. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Life Threatening flooding is occurring. Take action NOW to move to higher ground! If trapped, do not attempt to cross fast moving water. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
